alert.note: Alert for Portage; Waupaca; Waushara (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 5:18PM CST until February 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: The National Weather Service in Green Bay has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Portage County in central Wisconsin... Waushara County in central Wisconsin... Southwestern Waupaca County in northeastern Wisconsin... * Until 600 PM CST. * At 517 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Plainfield to 9 miles northwest of Westfield to 6 miles south of Mauston, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes U.S. Highway 10 between mile markers 237 and 267. This snow squall will be near... Hartman Creek State Park around 535 PM CST. Wautoma and Chain O' Lakes-King around 540 PM CST. Waupaca and Redgranite around 550 PM CST. Fremont around 600 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this snow squall include Coloma, Coddington, Hancock, Scandinavia, Borth, Kellner, King, Plover, Tustin and Manawa. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
